intro: Bomarea macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited bomarea, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Alstroemeriaceae and is characterized by its tuberous roots and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces large, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, contributing to its ornamental value. Bomarea macrocarpa thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests.
